website_summaries.verdict: Canvas material will give you a pliable exterior perfect for certain types of martial arts practice.
pros: Available in multiple sizes so you can pick the right one for your needs
Available only in the sitting position with hands in front, so it works best for practicing certain positions and holds
Solid construction will last a long time
Also offered in a leather material, but the canvas materials are less expensive
cons: Arrives unfilled, which saves on shipping costs, but you will have to fill it yourself

customer_reviews.title: Great dummy
customer_reviews.text: I made a skeleton out of PVC pipe so the dummy is able to be put in positions. My grandson loves him. The only problem so far is I’ve had to reinforce the sleeves the material tore out.
customer_reviews.author: C. Allen

customer_reviews.title: very good material. I purchase 47" blue canvas size
customer_reviews.text: Solid build. very good material. I purchase 47" blue canvas size. It's too small so I return and get 59". I think 70" is perfect. I use the swimming noodles and 1" diameter rod to construct the skeleton arm and leg. then I put in used clothes and sand bag ( small one). I practise all kind of submission like armbars, triangle chokes, leg lock .... It turns out very good dummy. I spend about 3 hrs to build this dummy.
customer_reviews.author: kimgia

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great for the price. Got this for me and my son to do bjj drills and didnt want to spend $500. Bought the biggest version and it takes a lot of stuffing! I had 2 king size cotton filled mattress toppers I was going to throw out so i figured one of those would be plenty. I used one entire topper and 1/3 of the other packing it very tight. Hardest part of stuffing it was getting down to the feet, after that its not bad. But I already knew that from other reviews. So far only thing I noticed is for certain submissions is the arms could be longer so i took off 1 star.
customer_reviews.author: what?

customer_reviews.title: DONT BUY — COMES APART AT STITCHING
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this product for over a year sitting around and have finally decided to fill it with old t-shirts. Come to find that the stitching is coming apart all over the thing as you can tell in the photos. I can basically pull at any part of the dummy and the seams will pull apart. DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.author: Brooks O'Dell

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service after the fact
customer_reviews.text: I had an issue with the stitching after I had stuffed it. Nothing major just a few spots where it was starting to pull apart. The major concern was I hadn’t even used it that was just from stuffing it. I co tasted the seller and they were quick to respond. We had resolved the issue completely in less than 15 minutes. This review is more about the customer service than the actual product. All in all I believe the product will serve the purpose and its a good value for the money spent. Is it the best dummy out there? Probably not but for the money invested I believe it’s well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: J.H.

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: So tough! I love this thing! It shipped faster then expected (although I got the wrong tracking number at first and thought they delivered to the wrong state and freaked out for a minute but the seller got right back to me and corrected the tracking number). It was easy to stuff, but I have experience with another dummy. I use the inside of a futon mattress and old clothes and bam! Really really great quality!
customer_reviews.author: K. Denton

customer_reviews.title: Low Quality Stitching Piece of Junk
customer_reviews.text: Low quality stitching. I had three spots rip just from filling it. I'm not satisfied at all. I had to lower to one star. This thing is falling apart after some light drilling. Total garbage. I don't even I know if a replacement is worth, but I'm definitely getting my money back. This is just with clothes. I had plans to put some sandbags.
customer_reviews.author: PM Mendez

customer_reviews.title: It comes unfilled so you have to stuff it with some form of rigid /light material to keep it looking like in the advertised photo
customer_reviews.text: Material seems tough enough to with stand a few rolls but not sure if it will last in the long run especially with the sewing patterns. Should be triple stitched at the critical points. It comes unfilled so you have to stuff it with some form of rigid /light material to keep it looking like in the advertised photo. I wound up returning the item. I'm sure for drill work, this would be okay but I rather preferred live drilling with a partner that moves.
customer_reviews.author: 86runner

customer_reviews.title: Great Training Buddy!
customer_reviews.text: Great training buddy for muscle memory of BJJ techniques. I initially bought and returned a 70# dummy. It was too heavy and not flexible at all. The grappling dummy is perfect. I spent about $50 ay Hobby Lobby on stuffing. Some advice on stuffing: get small pillow shaped stuffing for the head , hands and feet. Get the cylinder shaped stuffing for the arms and legs ( cut it into quarter strips). Again, I use it for muscle memory of techniques.
customer_reviews.author: PW

customer_reviews.title: save yourself, buy a stuffed one
customer_reviews.text: So I wanted a grappling dummy because I always want to drill but I hate people so I figured I could get my cake and eat it alone too. literally the hardest thing I’ve done in my entire life is stuff this dummy. during the process of stuffing, I’ve been hearing seems rip so I feel like that’s not a very good sign. Time will tell
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not happy
customer_reviews.text: I received this yesterday and while stuffing it already has a tear. What kind of warranty does it have. I am not happy. After stuffing it crotch area ripped open. Returned same.
customer_reviews.author: Frank B

customer_reviews.title: Drillers make Killers
customer_reviews.text: Great for drills and combos, pressure and escapes. Put a Gi on it and practice throws as well! Add pool noodles for arms and legs for added firmness. Limbs are durable but seams tend to crack with too much force. Decent build for price, an awesome supplement or mat training (Judo, Jiu Jitsu, Wrestling etc.)
customer_reviews.author: spartan907

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Within 2 days, dummy material started ripping at seams. Little boy is very upset. Mom has tried to repair 5 times now. Item is too large to return with stuffing now inserted. :(
customer_reviews.author: KLAN

customer_reviews.title: Stained and weak/torn fabric
customer_reviews.text: The dummy came with what looks like ink or paint stains all over. I tried contacting the seller but I did not get a response, so I thought we were stuck with it. I began to stuff the dummy anyway and it tore where the target is painted on the face. I guess the fabric was saturated with so much paint, it made the fabric super weak. I'm disappointed because this was a christmas present for my child who wont get much use out of it. I hope the company will get back to me to remedy this, otherwise I just lost out on a good chunk of change.
customer_reviews.author: Porsche P.

customer_reviews.title: Work as described
customer_reviews.text: I am laid bacj and hard to go to gym specially in this freezing weather , this will help you at home. I have had this from couple of weeks and like it.
customer_reviews.author: TechFreak

customer_reviews.title: Jimothy the basement protector.
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my husband to practice with, we named him jimothy and he scares everyone who goes into the basement. Very sturdy and durable, definitely plan on using 2-3x the amount of stuffing you think it might need.
customer_reviews.author: Cele-heart

customer_reviews.title: Expensive canvas bag.
customer_reviews.text: This is basically a canvas bag in the form of a anatomically incorrect human. It was some task to fill but that's not my issue. it has no structure and it's difficult to give it structure. Stuffing more or less does not help. The dummy will not sit in base. Basically it's $100 canvas bag. I read others bad reviews for this product and others like it but I assumed that I could do better. Imagined that it would be at least halfway usable.
customer_reviews.author: Tim S.

customer_reviews.title: I Shall Call Him Ronnie Jr.
customer_reviews.text: This is great for my kids and me to work out BJJ techniques and practice when someone of similar size is not around. We stuffed "Ronnie Jr." with old cloths and added an old BJJ Gi as his cover. After a few months, Jr is still in one piece even after taking quite a few arm bars.
customer_reviews.author: Bogie

customer_reviews.title: Indispensable practice tool
customer_reviews.text: When it arrived, one seam was already coming apart. More have followed, and I will likely have to take out the stuffing and fix them. HOWEVER, I use this thing almost every day and am so grateful to have it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Zobian

customer_reviews.title: seller good..product not so much
customer_reviews.text: tore in several placed before fully stuffed..worked with the seller to make it more worth the while but if you are looking for quality, this is not for you!!
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Filling the "Dummy"
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and another similar product for my nephew. The material on this product was pliable, which was a good thing. The zipper is strong as well but the opening is small and it was very hard to fill with the foam. My arms and hands were scratched from fingertips to elbows. Both! I used a long handle brush to push the filler into the arms and head. Used cortisone afterword to make sure that I did not get a reaction from the scratches. He better use it.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa La Rosa

customer_reviews.title: Stitching not spaced durably
customer_reviews.text: Stitching was not up to task. At least 3/4 to 1 inch spacing. Material not sure about. But stitching fir sure would have failed. Quickly returned.
customer_reviews.author: Ianc435

customer_reviews.title: Good for practicing some of my basics while watching mind-numbing ...
customer_reviews.text: I stuffed it with my old aikido gi's. Good for practicing some of my basics while watching mind-numbing tv. When I have nothing to do on a Sunday afternoon I run through some drills. It's good enough for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the kids 47” dummy for my daughter. Was delivered on time, but the waistline is ripped at the rear of the dummy. I wanted to order a dummy for myself next Spring, but I will repair this one and keep my money.
customer_reviews.author: P

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service
customer_reviews.text: Just got the dummy and it appears to be made well. I've stuffed other dummies in the past and this one seemed to be the easiest. The customer service is excellent and they truly stand by their product. I would be happy to bring my business to them again.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality Dummy
customer_reviews.text: Good quality dummy as long as you don't go nuts on the thing. Heard a couple stitches pop on an overzealous guillotine. It doesn't replace live rolling with a partner, but it's very helpful to work on little adjustments to techniques and build up muscle memory for things you go over quickly in class. As for stuffing, I used old clothes and bedding. When I ran out of stuff at home, I spent a few bucks on used blankets that the local goodwill. I was surprised by how much it to took to stuff thing, though.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Annett

customer_reviews.title: Seems very well made.
customer_reviews.text: Christmas gift for son who takes Jiu Jitsu. Absolutely loves it! Seems very well made. Do yourself a favor and research a dense lightweight fill before you fill it.
customer_reviews.author: EJ Indiana

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Better than expected! Durable! Easy to fill. Used old tee shirts. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: James Acquaviva

customer_reviews.title: P.O.S.
customer_reviews.text: I finally got around to using this grappling dummy due to the covid 19 lockdown. Filled it up with some material that was in a old punching bag I had. Start doing transitioning drills on it and one arm bar ripped the entire arm off. Not durable whatsoever
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not good for grappling, arms too short
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't not hold the shape pictured. Takes a long time to fill. Arms are too short.
customer_reviews.author: Trigger HappyTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Nice dummy
customer_reviews.text: Loving it. This thing is great my kids love it don't mess with my kids FYI unless you like to be treated like a dummy. Scary at night be careful
customer_reviews.author: Cman714

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: My son uses it for Jiu Jitsu practice and it really is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: ManMan85

customer_reviews.title: Ripped already during packing
customer_reviews.text: Size, dimensions as described and pictured. Quality of stitching and also material light, not design for any significant strain, physical stress. Stitching ripped in two places during packing with soft small foam pieces. Needed Gorilla tape enforcement in multiple places. Do not expect this Grappling Dummy to last long.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: BJJ DUMMY
customer_reviews.text: Awesome tool for BJJ. I bought it for my 6 yr old daughter. There's nothing like sparring with a live partner. But this dummy allows her to perfect her move. The arms, head, and bent legs of the dummy are perfectly life like.
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: but other than that he was very good quality. I filled him up with old clothes/towels ...
customer_reviews.text: I wish this guy had longer limbs, but other than that he was very good quality. I filled him up with old clothes/towels that I had to cut into smaller pieces.
customer_reviews.author: youo

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I love it and so do my boys. I filled with old clothes but I did read that some used pool noodles for the arms, so I might switch them out, but it's great. Been rolling with it and it is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Marco F. Uresti

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this dummy..!
customer_reviews.text: Don’t buy this product.. hadn’t even finished stuffing it & it ripped straight away.. didn’t even stuff it that much & used baby clothes as there small & easy to fill it with.. the sewing is faulty
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price!!
customer_reviews.text: Great for the price. I stuffed it with old rags and used a wooden stick to jam the stuff tight. Definitely worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Jitzplayer

customer_reviews.title: Good workout buddy
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my husband cuz I promised I would spar with him but I got lazy so I got him this as a substitute. He wishes it was a little longer in the arms and legs but otherwise he gets a good workout and can practice his techniques. He stuffed it with old clothes and it's a great place to store t-shirts that you never wear but don't want to get rid of cuz of sentimental value. He dressed it up in sweats, a t-shirt and a Deadpool mask.
customer_reviews.author: Kay P

customer_reviews.title: Very low quality, **UPDATE**
customer_reviews.text: **Update - Working with seller for refund, May have been temporary problem** Our school ordered 7 dummies, and they all are showing signs of damage within 2 weeks of use. Many are ripping through the seams in multiple places.
customer_reviews.author: Jerad Downs

customer_reviews.title: It isn't able to keep the kneeling pose very well but my son is fine with it
customer_reviews.text: This came in a small package which made me a little hesitant, but after laying it out and beginning to stuff it with old towels and sheets it really came to life. It took about 6 beach towels and 5 full size sheets to stuff. It isn't able to keep the kneeling pose very well but my son is fine with it. He mainly picks it up and jumps on it. it's heavy and seems durable so far.
customer_reviews.author: Angela B.

customer_reviews.title: Still a good dummy for specific drills
customer_reviews.text: found the arms to be a little short for me, and I wish there was a bit more resilience in body position. Still a good dummy for specific drills, but limited in application.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Vazquez

customer_reviews.title: Unsatisfied with the quality
customer_reviews.text: Maybe this product shouldn’t be bought for children 🤷🏻‍♀️ (My son is 10, taking bjj) but I definitely didn’t expect the product to have a hole in it less than three days in. It’s not a seam rip, it is a hole directly in the center of the red dot in the head of the dummy. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Leah

customer_reviews.title: Not durable. Tore up the first time I used it
customer_reviews.text: This product is not good. I used it one time and pulled an arm bar and I ripped the arm off of it. And I had an adult gi on it.
customer_reviews.author: dlsmithy

customer_reviews.title: can't beat the price...
customer_reviews.text: if you're on budget it's awesome... I filled the -legs with an old memory foam top ( duct tapped the feet shape) - the arms are puzzle mat ends ( next to dummy) -the torso/ head are a child's size punching bag wrapped around a child's size chest protector
customer_reviews.author: J.Gomez

customer_reviews.title: Waste of time and money!
customer_reviews.text: Absolute crap. Do not waste your time! First one ripped on filling and replacement ripped too!
customer_reviews.author: MMA

customer_reviews.title: Ripped after two days.
customer_reviews.text: It was exactly what we wanted, but it got a rip in it after only two days.
customer_reviews.author: Kris Simanton

customer_reviews.title: Ripped as I was filling
customer_reviews.text: Ripped as I was filling. Scared to roll with it and get sand everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good dummy
customer_reviews.text: Great grappling dummy, stuffing it is a bit tedious but you can do it to your specific needs. My suggestion is to buy an old & cheap heavy bag used somewhere and cut it open for stuffing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ripped
customer_reviews.text: Did not expect to pay as much as I did for something that had 2 rips in it and where I had to find clothes to stuff it with as it wasn't even stuffed or the weight I said. It was something I had to stuff myself.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good as expected
customer_reviews.text: Everything is actually good. I cant get it to sit up right. Probably error on my end for filling it the wrong way. My brother is like 6 so he had a blast. Felt like at time he was getting beat up by it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not Good Value
customer_reviews.text: I do not appreciate having to stuff this training dummy myself. I can do it, but why do I have to? I paid good money for it! I will not buy from this company again.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Bartkowski

customer_reviews.title: Not durable at all, never been used
customer_reviews.text: 1st Product had preexisting tear. Replacement tore when stuffing the leg. Having doubts that this is authentic product, extremely light material and treads.
customer_reviews.author: sam

customer_reviews.title: Good dummy
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product! For the price I don't think you can beat it. It arrived a day early so that was cool. Stuffing it took a little bit of work but nothing major. I stuffed it with old clothes and sheets. I definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Marquis

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Gift
customer_reviews.text: My son loves his gift! He likes the flexibility of adding or removing the “stuffing” to his liking. Great quality!
customer_reviews.author: Christy S Easley

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT buy!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Set this up for my son for Christmas...it really smelled horrible which the seller said might happen but dang! This wasn’t the odd smell you he from new leather but a smell like it wasn’t treated correctly. Seams were lose and the first arm bar my son practiced tore the arm. His form was great and it’s not like he should have been able to tear it like that....the kid is 6....No idea how to reach the company and it stunk so bad we had to throw it out. WASTE of MONEY!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality but stuffing was difficult and tedious.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality. I will have to say, however, that stuffing this guy was time-consuming and a struggle. Getting the stuffing down in to the feet and making it firm was hard. We ended up using the end of a broom to read down in there and push the material where it needed to go. We still have half of him to stuff as we ran out of stuffing material we were using. But for the cost savings, it was well worth the effort.
customer_reviews.author: Jotaluke

customer_reviews.title: TOTAL GARBAGE product DON"T buy this product!
customer_reviews.text: Ripped at the seams while stuffing it. My wife sewed it together and it then ripped two more times a the seams in different places .Simply just trash.
customer_reviews.author: E Rod

customer_reviews.title: Great for wrestling and martial arts
customer_reviews.text: This is a good reasonable product that will help in training!
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Great Jiu Jitsu Dummy!!
customer_reviews.text: Fast shipping. Grappling dummy comes unstuffed. I stuffed mine with old linen and tshirts. Works well to practice your jiu jitsu moves!
customer_reviews.author: Briana

customer_reviews.title: junk
customer_reviews.text: This thing lasted 3 months and ripped literally in half, dont waste your money its garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Raman L.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent build quality, and functions very well
customer_reviews.text: I bought the leather version, and the build quality is excellent. I used tennis balls to easily stuff the feet, and I bought old blankets from a thrift store and cut them up and stuffed the dummy with them. I’m very satisfied with it. I especially love practicing armbar from guard.
customer_reviews.author: Kurtis Metcalfe

customer_reviews.title: fragile and tears easily
customer_reviews.text: My little nephews broke it on the first day... weak product can't stand what it was "made for" I want my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Fabio

customer_reviews.title: well built grappling dummy
customer_reviews.text: This product is built very well. I grappled with it and it can withstand the twists and punches I give it. You may have to put very thin strips of cloth and tightly pack it in the feet and legs. It was a challenge to get stuffing down there.
customer_reviews.author: Gideon

customer_reviews.title: No big complaints
customer_reviews.text: It’s a good dummy, stuffing it is a bit of a pain.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen C

customer_reviews.title: husband no longer doing moves on me and im girl ...
customer_reviews.text: husband no longer doing moves on me and im girl thank God i got this one for him and he saids his bjj has improved
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very well made.
customer_reviews.text: Really strong construction. My sons smash this thing. Great trainer.
customer_reviews.author: John Dough

customer_reviews.title: Very low quality!!
customer_reviews.text: Very low quality!! Do not buy!! I did not even get 10 % of the ways stuffing it and the arm tore.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great product, the material(canvas) is good quality and shipping was really fast.
customer_reviews.author: maliante007

customer_reviews.title: Fun!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome. Gift from Santa for 7 year old. Used wornout clothes to fill. So far it’s holding up great, It’s taking a beating. My son uses it to practice wrestling moves and play.
customer_reviews.author: SK

customer_reviews.title: It ripped the 2rd time i rolled with it. ...
customer_reviews.text: It ripped the 2rd time i rolled with it. And the celebrita sticker on chest is already peeling. Can I send this one back for replacement please?
customer_reviews.author: Keith Doute

customer_reviews.title: I love that product
customer_reviews.text: I purchesed few months before very nice and good quality product.i am still using it.
customer_reviews.author: futureworld

customer_reviews.title: More work than worth!
customer_reviews.text: Received order as promised. Filled with kick bag material and foam noodles for structure. My 12 yr old son slammed bag twice and noticed small tears in seam. Very disappointed since this is what he wanted for his birthday.
customer_reviews.author: Toa

customer_reviews.title: Thank you
customer_reviews.text: I just wish I had read it before ordering. I wanted it filled. No big deal
customer_reviews.author: Jason Yiannakis

customer_reviews.text: Great dummy. ONLY arms are shorter than it looks like on picture ......
customer_reviews.author: PetrH

customer_reviews.title: Amazon nice enough to give me a discount
customer_reviews.text: 10/7/17 Ripped while stuffing it. Gonna sew it myself. Hope it holds up while grappling. Amazon nice enough to give me a discount.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Coker

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: After only a few weeks of use it began tearing at the seams
customer_reviews.author: Steve Brown

customer_reviews.title: Smelly but useful
customer_reviews.text: When this dummy first arrived it does smell pretty bad so I would recommend setting it outside to "air out". To fill the dummy I just used old clothes like shirts socks an old pillow stuffing I didn't really have any problems with filling any of the legs or arms. The only con I can think of is it's hard to get it to sit up with out it falling backwards or to the sides. In my opinion though I rather have spent the money for this empty dummy and filled it myself then spend $300 plus on the dummy that's already filled.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great for MMA & Judo learning
customer_reviews.text: excellent product, I filled it and gave it present to my son and he is happy with his training.
customer_reviews.author: HELLOLIV

customer_reviews.title: poor design, can't get feet stuffed
customer_reviews.text: Arrived with no stuffing... so we had to find something to stuff with... not the best purchase but we did end up using it as a scarecrow type monster on the front porch for halloween... it would be nice if they would have made recommendations for what to stuff it with... we tried sand and it made it 200 lbs.. not a great idea... old clothing / rags is a good idea but good luck getting the stuffing down to the feet... IMPOSSIBLE
customer_reviews.author: Mel Scooper

customer_reviews.title: Very durable
customer_reviews.text: “Dummy Dave” is perfect for my 7 yr old to practice his BJJ technique. Very durable. We stuffed it with shredded t shirts and old bed sheets.
customer_reviews.author: Dixie Normous

customer_reviews.title: Best Gift for Fitness Husband
customer_reviews.text: I ordered it for my Husband he loved Kick boxing. It his now lucky charm in the basement. It arrived on time and liked the material.
customer_reviews.author: Ambishopper

customer_reviews.title: I really needed something more sturdy. A good dummy for occasional use and light ...
customer_reviews.text: The material was too thin. I really needed something more sturdy. A good dummy for occasional use and light drilling.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth J Gies

customer_reviews.title: Really good product
customer_reviews.text: It seems to be made of a great, durable material with great workmanship that will hopefully serve for long
customer_reviews.author: Ameer Khoja

customer_reviews.title: Not too bad for the price
customer_reviews.text: Not too bad for the price. Wish it was more durable though. Ripped in a few places with minor usage.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A. Arocho

customer_reviews.title: What do I put in it???
customer_reviews.text: Came in great condition, but wasn't stuffed or even tells you what to stuff it with.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Partner that never complains.....
customer_reviews.text: Very cool training aide. I can drill alot of things when I do not have a partner. I filled it with old sheets and t-shirts. I also used pool noodles in the legs to give them more structure.
customer_reviews.author: Terry & Angie

customer_reviews.title: great buy....
customer_reviews.text: this thing is great. i just filled it with old clothes. i would keep it out of the living room though, because my wife walked in early one morning, and it was on the floor. she had forgotten i bought it, and screamed. i guess she thought a strange man was laying on the floor with his arm and kneck broke.
customer_reviews.author: shane

customer_reviews.title: Very Satisfied!!
customer_reviews.text: This grappling dummy was very tedious to fill. I purchased the 70" dummy and the legs are very long. It was very hard to reach the feet and lower legs to fill it. It took approximately 4 hours over the course of a week to fill this dummy. However, it was worth the effort. The material is thick and the stitching appears to be very durable. It was shipped from Pakistan and arrived very quickly. I am very pleased so far.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: durable practice dummy
customer_reviews.text: After my wife stuffed it with old clothes, its pretty cool. Its made of a really tuff material. My son can use it instead of me to practice his wrestling moves on.
customer_reviews.author: van stricklin

customer_reviews.title: An option to purchase inexpensive stuffing would make this better.
customer_reviews.text: Seems well made but I am having difficulty getting it properly stuffed.
customer_reviews.author: Charles M tressler

customer_reviews.title: hands and feet with socks or small sized clothes then the other parts will come easy
customer_reviews.text: Fast shipping! Just filled it up! And it wasn't hard! Start filling the head, hands and feet with socks or small sized clothes then the other parts will come easy
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: He says he feels much better after taking it out on an appropriate object - ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my grandson (5), who has a bit of an anger issue. He used to stomp his feet and get red in the face when overly upset. I stuffed with throw away clothing, rags etc. He can kick it, punch it, or wrestle with it. He says he feels much better after taking it out on an appropriate object - and- He loves it. I got the gel shock youth handwraps to protect his hands too. It is sturdily made (canvas), and can take a "whooping" by a five year old.
customer_reviews.author: Diane of the Desert

customer_reviews.title: This is very useful to practice techniques of BJJ
customer_reviews.text: This is very useful to practice techniques of BJJ. My size-59 dummy fits A2 size gi well althoug arm of the dummy are s little bit short. Totally I am satisgied with the product.

customer_reviews.author: J. Harth

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for 5yr old
customer_reviews.text: This product was perfect for my five-year-old son. It was very difficult for me to practice Jiu-Jitsu moves with him because I'm so much larger than him. This product allowed him to practice all the moves and then directly apply it to class. This product work exactly like I hoped it would. It was very easy to stuff and get it ready for use. I would suggest buying bulk Rags at Walmart or an auto parts store that you can use the stuff the body with or any clothing that you no longer use. Overall great product!
customer_reviews.author: Petermr2008

product_meta.title: Celebrita MMA Grappling Dummy - Judo Punching Bag, Unfilled - Sitting Position Hands Front
feature_bullets: This dummy comes unfilled. You can fill it up to 100lb depending no the material you fill it up with. Images are for illustration of the final looking product once you fill it. You can fill with recycle textile cuttings or shredding. Can also be filled up with raw cotton or any suitable filler material. 40" to 47" dummies are suitable for kids. 59" to 70" dummies are suitable for adults.

Postures on its knees and elbows so you can prepare both quarter position/ turtle position and sprawl position procedures.Any leather dummies may smell initially because all dummies made of leather always may have some smell due to fresh leather being used for few days

Keeps its legs curved a 90 degrees at the hips the way a genuine adversary does as such you get more reasonable preparing (when contrasted with the "straight legged" hooking dummy that are implied for tossing… not accommodation catching).
Has the legs curved at the hips, which permits you to accomplish MORE accommodation, jiu jitsu and catching strategies, than whatever other style MMA dummy, jiu jitsu dummy or hooking dummy.

Any dummy in sitting position may show 10-11" lesser if you lay it on floor and measure the size of flat laying dummy because the amount of actual material used is longer but due to sitting position, you may not be able to notice it if you lay it down to measure it.
